text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The criterion requires reference to case law, such as U&M Mining Zambia v Konkola Copper Mines (2014), to illustrate that English courts may grant freezing injunctions in support of foreign arbitrations where assets are located within their jurisdiction. The candidate answer explicitly cites *Cetelem SA v Roust Holdings Ltd* [2005] EWCA Civ 618, *Perusahaan Penerbangan Malaysia v Swissport* [2010] EWHC 1294 (Comm), *The Angelic Grace* [1995] 1 Lloyd\u2019s Rep 87, *Enka Insaat v OOO Insurance* [2020] UKSC 38, and *Gloster v GFL* [2016] EWHC 2743 (Comm). While it does not cite the specific case mentioned in the criterion (*U&M Mining Zambia v Konkola Copper Mines (2014)*), it clearly satisfies the core requirement of referring to relevant case law to illustrate the principle of granting freezing injunctions in support of foreign arbitrations.", "criterion_id": "686d1bfe-361c-4471-9a44-c07b70513d13"}
